author: Special Correspondent
text:
Youth witness an exhibit on road safety at the Corporation Bus Stand in Erode on Sunday. —PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

Road Safety Week commenced with an awareness exhibition at the Corporation Bus Stand and a rally by students in Erode district on Sunday.

The week-long events will be on the theme: ‘Road Safety - Time for Action’.

Environment Minister Thoppu N.D. Venkatachalam inaugurated the exhibition in the presence of District Collector S. Prabakar, Superintendent of Police M.R. Sibi Chakravarthy, Mayor Malliga Paramasivam and other dignitaries. About 350 students of AET Matriculation School and Nandha Group of Institutions and members of Driving School Associations took part in the rally.

The schedule for conduct of Road Safety Week has been devised by the Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways to create awareness among general public on improving road safety, and involving all stakeholders to the cause.

The events will focus on sensitising public to the causes for road accidents and measures to prevent them.

According to official statistics, 1.4 lakh persons are killed in road crashes every year, and many more get injured and disabled for life. Youth in the age group of 15 to 24 years account for 33 per cent of the total fatalities.

While the National Road Safety Policy is being implemented in right earnest, reflecting in improved road engineering, enhanced enforcement and scaled-up emergency care, the Central Government is keen on involving citizens to make road safety a social movement.
title: Exhibition, rally mark start of Road Safety Week
